intro: Indigofera amorphoides, commonly known as the African indigo or wild indigo, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to various regions in Africa and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow to greenish flowers that are clustered in racemes, and it is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen through symbiotic bacteria in its root nodules. Indigofera amorphoides is often used in traditional medicine and as a forage plant for livestock due to its nutritional value.
